content:
BPM Festival是一年一度的电子音乐节，在葡萄牙的波尔蒂芒举行。

 

历史

BPM Festival是一年一度的持续十天十夜的电子音乐节，由Craig Pettigrew 和Philip Pulitano创办，在墨西哥的普拉亚德尔卡门举行。BPM是 "调酒师、促销员、音乐家 "的缩写，创建于2008年，是新年后行业专业人士的聚会，现已发展成为全球70,000多名DJ、制作人、狂欢者和行业专业人士的聚会，有400多名DJ和80多个活动。 BPM派对白天和晚上都在普拉亚德尔卡门的多个场地举办，这是一个风景如画的海滨城市，沿着玛雅海岸数英里的柔软白沙海滩和闪亮的碧水。该活动分为白天和晚上的展示，由不同的厂牌和推广人主办，横跨普拉亚德尔卡门的各个场地，包括海滩俱乐部、夜总会甚至地下餐厅，包括DIYNAMIC、elrow、ENTER.、Innervisions、Life and Death、Paradise、SCI+TEC和更多。普拉亚德卡门提供各种经济实惠的精品酒店和公寓，以及餐饮和旅游的选择，包括古玛雅遗址、天然井、水上运动和生态旅游。

 

2013年，BPM Festival 赢得了伊比沙岛DJ奖的 "国际音乐节 "奖，2016年连续第三年被国际舞蹈音乐奖提名为 "最佳音乐活动"，并在首届电子音乐奖及基金会中获得 "年度音乐节"。此外，BPM音乐节在2015年赢得了EMPO奖的 "最佳音乐节"，并在2016年获得提名。现在已经进入第十个年头，BPM音乐节继续成为舞蹈音乐爱好者的热带天堂和完美的冬季度假胜地。

 

2012年约有35,000人参加了BPM音乐节，现在已经发展到来自72个国家的70,000多人。2013年活动名单上的艺术家包括Richie Hawtin, Sasha, Jamie Jones, Damian Lazarus, Carl Cox, Maceo Plex, Soul Clap, Wolf + Lamb, Lee Burridge, Dixon, Loco Dice 和 Luciano。第10届于2017年1月举行，其阵容包括Carl Cox, Cassy, Dubfire, Erick Morillo, Guy Gerber, John Digweed, Lee Curtiss, Lee Foss, Marco Carola, Nicole Moudaber, Pete Tong, Seth Troxler, Skream, Solomun, Soul Clap, The Martinez Brothers, 和 Wolf + Lamb。

 

2017年枪击案，迁往葡萄牙

2017年1月16日，在蓝鹦鹉夜总会举行的音乐节闭幕活动中，一名枪手的袭击造成4人死亡，15人受伤。一名妇女也在随后因枪声而发生的踩踏事件中死亡，组织者确认其中三名遇难者是音乐节的安保人员。枪击事件发生后，一张由贩毒集团Los Zetas留下的宣称对此次袭击负责的麻醉剂图片流传开来。信息中具体提到了BPM和 Philip Pulitano，说他们 "没有排队"，还包含对敌对帮派的威胁。虽然当局尚未将枪击事件与Los Zetas联系起来，但一位熟悉此事的人士告诉CBC新闻网，这次袭击可能是不遵守该团伙要求的结果。枪击事件发生后，据报道，组织者已经躲起来了。

 

2017年1月16日，市长Cristina Torres Gómez在《环球报》上表示，该市的立场是不再允许BPM的组织者在那里举行活动。Maria Helena Mata Pineda，里维埃拉-玛雅商业协调委员会的主席，呼吁禁止该地区的所有电子音乐活动，她说："我们不希望BPM在这里，或任何其他类似活动。我们不想要它，我们感谢当局倾听我们的意见。"2017年1月24日，组织者发布了关于枪击事件的第一份官方声明，报告说15名受伤的与会者中有14人已经出院。组织者还表示，将枪击事件归咎于卡特尔活动的新闻报道是 "基于不明来源的猜测和错误信息"。

 

在一次演出中，组织者曾宣布，2017年将是在墨西哥举办的最后一届，因为他们正在考虑将该节日转移到巴西或葡萄牙。2017年4月，宣布该活动将于2017年9月首次在葡萄牙的Praia da Rocha举办。

 

2018年

2018年的音乐节于2018年9月20日至23日在波尔蒂芒举行。与会艺人包括：Craig Richards, Joseph Capriati, Octave One, Patrick Topping等人。

 

2019年

2019年的音乐节于9月12日至15日在波尔蒂芒举行。艺人包括：Laurent Garnier, Paco Osuna, Loco Dice, Stefan Bodzin。
contentEn:
The BPM Festival is an annual electronic music festival, held in Portimão, Portugal.[1]

 

History

The BPM Festival is an annual ten day and night electronic music festival, founded by Craig Pettigrew and Philip Pulitano, held in Playa Del Carmen, Mexico. BPM, which stands for “Bartenders, Promoters, Musicians” was created in 2008 as a post-New Year's gathering of industry professionals and has grown to a 70,000+ global gathering of DJs, producers, revelers and industry professionals featuring over 400 DJs and 80+ events.[2] BPM parties are hosted both day and night at multiple venues in Playa Del Carmen,[3] a picturesque beach town that runs along miles of soft white sand beaches and sparkling turquoise waters on the Mayan Riviera. The program is split into day and night showcases hosted by different record labels and promoters,[4] across various venues in Playa del Carmen, including beachclubs, nightclubs and even an underground restaurant[5][6][7] including DIYNAMIC, elrow, ENTER., Innervisions, Life and Death, Paradise, SCI+TEC and many more. Playa del Carmen offers a variety of affordable boutique hotels and condos, and options for dining and tourism, including ancient Mayan ruins, cenotes, aquatic sports and ecotourism.

 

In 2013, The BPM Festival won the "International Festival" award[8] from DJ Awards in Ibiza and in 2016 was nominated by International Dance Music Awards for "Best Music Event" for a third year in a row, as well as “Festival of the Year” at the first ever Electronic Music Awards & Foundation. In addition, The BPM Festival won "Best Festival" in the EMPO Awards in 2015 with a nomination in 2016. Now embarking on its tenth year, The BPM Festival continues to be a dance music lover's tropical paradise and the perfect winter getaway.

 

Approximately 35,000 people attended The BPM Festival in 2012[9] which has grown to over 70,000 from 72 countries.[10] Artists on the 2013 schedule include Richie Hawtin, Sasha, Jamie Jones, Damian Lazarus, Carl Cox, Maceo Plex, Soul Clap, Wolf + Lamb, Lee Burridge, Dixon, Loco Dice and Luciano.[4] | The 10th edition was held in January 2017, with its line-up featuring Carl Cox, Cassy, Dubfire, Erick Morillo, Guy Gerber, John Digweed, Lee Curtiss, Lee Foss, Marco Carola, Nicole Moudaber, Pete Tong, Seth Troxler, Skream, Solomun, Soul Clap, The Martinez Brothers, and Wolf + Lamb.[11]

 

2017 shooting, move to Portugal

On 16 January 2017, four people were killed and fifteen were wounded by a "lone shooter" during a closing event for the festival at the Blue Parrot nightclub. A woman also died in a stampede that ensued as a result of the gunfire. Organizers identified three of the victims killed as being part of the festival's security staff. An image of a narcomanta claiming responsibility for the attack, left by the drug cartel Los Zetas, circulated following the shootings. The message contained specific references to BPM and Philip Pulitano, stated that they "didn't get in line", and also contained threats against rival gangs. While authorities had not yet connected the shootings to Los Zetas, a person familiar with the matter told CBC News that the attack might have been the result of non-compliance with the gang's demands.[12][13][14] Following the shooting, it was reported that the organizers had gone into hiding.[14]

 

On 16 January 2017, Mayor Cristina Torres Gómez stated in El Universal that the city's stance was to no longer allow BPM's organizers to hold events there. Maria Helena Mata Pineda, president of Riviera Maya's Business Coordinating Council, called for a ban of all electronic music events in the region, stating that "We don't want BPM here anymore, or any other similar event. We don't want it and we thank the authorities who are listening."[15][16] On 24 January 2017, organizers released their first official statement regarding the shooting, reporting that 14 of the 15 attendees wounded had been released from hospital. The organizers also stated that news reports attributing the shooting to cartel activity were "based on speculation and misinformation from unidentified sources".[17]

 

During one of its shows, organizers had announced that the 2017 edition would be the final edition held in Mexico, as they were considering moving the festival to Brazil or Portugal.[14][18] In April 2017, it was announced that the event would be held at Praia da Rocha, Portugal for the first time in September 2017.[19][20]

 

2018 Festival

The 2018 edition of the festival took place 20th - 23rd September 2018, in Portimao. With artists including: Craig Richards, Joseph Capriati, Octave One, Patrick Topping and more performing at the festival [21]

 

2019 Festival

The 2019 edition took place across 12-15th September, in Portimao. With Laurent Garnier, Paco Osuna, Loco Dice, Stefan Bodzin all in performing. [22]

name: BPM Festival
descriptions: BPM音乐节是一年一度的电子音乐节，在葡萄牙的波尔蒂芒举行。
